q1.q: How to add my first product?
q1.a: Go to the Products tab, press the '+' button at the bottom right. Fill in the name, selling price, and initial stock. You can also scan an existing barcode.

q2.a: Go to the Checkout tab. Scan your items or search for them in the list. Add to cart, link a customer if desired, choose payment mode and validate.

q3.a: In the Customers (CRM) tab, select a customer then go to the Account tab. You can record a manual debt or a payment. Balance is updated in real-time.

q4.q: How to order from a supplier?
q4.a: Go to Orders, click '+'. Select the supplier (manual or marketplace), add products and validate. Upon receipt, confirm delivery to update stock.

q5.a: In Settings > Users, add a new user with their email. Set their permissions module by module and share credentials via WhatsApp.

q6.a: Use the shop selector at the top right of the screen. All data (stock, sales, accounting) switches to the selected shop.

q7.a: Yes! Your data is stored in the cloud and synchronized in real-time. A local cache allows viewing data even offline.

q8.a: From the Dashboard (History button > download icon) or from Accounting, export to CSV. Invoices export to PDF.

q9.a: In the Alerts tab, press the gear icon to access rules. Enable the desired alert types and adjust thresholds as needed.

q10.q: How to send a receipt via WhatsApp?
q10.a: After validating a sale in Checkout, the confirmation screen shows a 'Share' button. Choose WhatsApp and select the contact.

q11.a: In the Accounting tab, press 'Create an invoice'. Add lines with description, quantity, price, and VAT. The invoice is generated as a PDF.

q12.a: Enable the program in Settings > Loyalty. Define the points ratio (e.g., 1 point per fixed amount). Points accumulate at each sale and customers automatically progress through tiers.

f1.d: Track your daily and monthly revenue, product count, and total stock value. Counters animate in real-time.

f2.d: Visualize at a glance how many products are out of stock (red), low stock (orange), or overstocked (blue). Click a badge to see the products.

f3.d: If you manage products with expiry dates (batches), those expiring in the next 30 days are automatically displayed with the batch number.

f4.d: The system analyzes your sales history and automatically suggests products to order, with optimal quantity and priority level.

f5.d: Your products are classified into 3 groups based on their contribution to revenue: Class A (80%), Class B (15%), and Class C (5%). Focus on Class A.

f6.d: Access detailed charts (stock evolution, breakdown by category) and full movement history with filters and CSV export.

f1.d: Find a product by typing its name or SKU. Filter by category using the colored horizontal chips.

f2.d: Each product displays a colored badge: Red (Out of Stock), Orange (Low Stock), Blue (Overstocked), Green (Normal). Thresholds are configurable per product.

f3.d: The 'In' and 'Out' buttons allow adjusting stock without creating an order. Specify the reason (delivery, loss, inventory, etc.).

f4.d: Generate labels with QR code, name, price, and barcode. Print them for your shelves or share them.

f5.d: The gear icon opens the category manager. Create, edit, or delete categories with custom colors and icons.

f6.d: For food products, create batches with expiry dates. Lots expiring soon trigger automatic alerts.

f7.d: Check the buy and sell price history of each product to optimize your margins.

f2.d: Add, remove, or modify quantities in the cart. The total recalculates in real-time with each change.

f3.d: Link an existing customer to the sale or create a new one in 2 seconds. Loyalty points are credited automatically.

f4.d: Accept 5 payment modes: cash, mobile money, credit card, bank transfer, and credit sale.

f5.d: After validation, print the receipt or send it via WhatsApp or email. The receipt includes full transaction details.

f6.d: Loyalty points are calculated and credited automatically at each purchase. The customer progresses through tiers (Bronze → Platinum).

f1.d: Select a supplier (manual or marketplace), add products with quantities and prices, set the expected delivery date.

f2.d: Follow each order: Pending → Confirmed → Shipped → Delivered. The visual progress bar shows the advancement.

f4.d: Manually link a product from the supplier catalog to a product in your inventory, even after delivery.

f5.d: Filter by status, supplier, or period to find an order.

f5.d: Keep track of your exchanges: calls, visits, emails. Add notes for each interaction.

f1.d: Register your customers with name, phone, email, and birth date. Track their full purchase history.

f2.d: Configure points-per-purchase ratio and reward tiers. Tiers (Bronze, Silver, Gold, Platinum) calculate automatically.

f3.d: Record credit sales and repayments. Customer balance is always up to date.

f4.d: Send promotional SMS or emails targeted by loyalty tier or individual selection.

f5.d: Create promotions with percentage discount or loyalty points exchange. Enable/disable as needed.

f6.d: Record birth dates for automatic personalized offers and to strengthen customer relations.

f2.d: Track your revenue, cost of goods, gross and net profit. Identify the most and least profitable products.

f3.d: Create professional invoices with VAT, detailed lines, and contact info. Send via email or print.

f4.d: Categorize your expenses (rent, salaries, transport, electricity, etc.) for a complete and precise balance sheet.

f5.d: Visualize payment breakdown, expenses by category, and daily revenue evolution.
